business.headline: Bull run on Dalal Street: Will the stock market rally last? The stock market saw a bull run in the last session with the benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, both closing over 1.5% higher, driven by gains in banking and financial stocks.

GST Council to decide on fewer, lower tax rates soon: Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated on Tuesday that the GST Council is close to finalising a decision on tax rate rationalisation, with the review process nearly complete. At present, the Goods and Services Tax (GST) is structured into four slabs: 5 per cent, 12 per cent, 18 per cent, and 28 per cent.

5 key tax reforms for middle class introduced in Budget 2025 Union Budget 2025: The new tax structure announced in the Union Budget 2025 aims to ease the financial burden of the middle class, enhancing their disposable income and giving a boost to their consumption levels.
Consumption vs capex: Has the government prioritised spending over growth?Budget 2025 provided tax relief for taxpayers, but the government also maintained its fiscal deficit target at 4.4% of GDP.

Budget 2025: What's in it for farmers, agriculture and rural businesses?Budget 2025 aims to modernise India's agricultural landscape and reinforces the government's commitment to sustainable agriculture and farmer empowerment.

Sensex jumps over 1,000 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayAt 1:34 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 981.63 points at 77,918.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 286.90 points to trade at 23,647.95.

Explained: Why Volkswagen has sued Indian authoritiesAccording to the government, Volkswagen broke down imports of some VW, Skoda, and Audi cars into separate components, instead of declaring them as completely knocked down (CKD) units.

entertainment.headline: Netflix removes Karla Sofia Gascon from Oscar campaign after controversial postsEmilia Perez actor Karla Sofia Gascon has been removed from Netflix's Oscar campaign for the film. This comes following backlash over her controversial posts in the past.

Nadaaniyan: Introducing the parents of Khushi Kapoor and Ibrahim Ali KhanThe official social media handle of Karan Johar's Dharmatic Entertainment has shared photos of the core Nadaaniyan team. It stars Khushi Kapoor and Ibrahim Ali Khan in the lead.

Avinash Tiwary jokes that theirs offers the real family drama.

Sarah Michelle Gellar to star in Buffy the Vampire Slayer sequel: ReportActor Sarah Michelle Gellar will reportedly be reprising her role as Buffy Summers for Buffy the Vampire Slayer's sequel on Hulu. Chloe Zhao is in talks to direct the show.

Game Changer OTT release: When and where to watch Ram Charan-Kiara Advani filmRam Charan's Game Changer OTT release date: Shankar's telugu directorial, Game Changer, is all set to stream on OTT soon. Read details about when and where you can watch the Ram Charan and Kiara Advani-starrer on OTT.

During their appearance, Karisma recreated one of her iconic scenes from Hum Saath Saath Hain with Badshah.

Dining With The Kapoors: Kareena, Ranbir, and family bond over food and filmsThe entire Kapoor Khandaan including Kareena Kapoor, Ranbir Kapoor, Karisma Kapoor, and others have united for a Netflix special film, Dining With the Kapoors. The project was announced as a part of the Netflix 2025 slate.
Did Samay Raina joke about Rekha on Amitabh Bachchan's KBC 16? Here's the truthA viral video shows Samay Raina joking about Rekha with Amitabh Bachchan on KBC 16, but it appears to be doctored.

Pics: Sonu Nigam performs at Rashtrapati Bhavan after suffering back painSonu Nigam performed at Rashtrapati Bhavan despite suffering from a severe back spasm just a day back. The singer performed on the occasion of Rashtrapati Bhavan Diwas.

Associated Press apologises to Babyface for cutting short Grammy interviewAP apologised to 12-time Grammy-winning composer Babyface after cutting his interview short on the Grammys red carpet. Stars like Khloé Kardashian criticised the journalists for disrespecting the music legend.

SRK jokes about being 'Naam ka producer' at son Aryan's directorial launchShah Rukh Khan launched his son, Aryan Khan's directorial debut project, The Ba***ds of Bollywood, on February 3. During the Netflix event, the actor referred to himself as 'naam ka producer'.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood: SRK launches son Aryan Khan's directorial debut Shah Rukh Khan launched the upcoming project, The Ba***ds of Bollywood, which marks the directorial debut of his son, Aryan Khan. The actor unveiled the announcement video during the Netflix 2025 event.

Test teaser: R Madhavan, Nayanthara and Siddharth set for 'test of life'The teaser of TEST, starring R Madhavan, Nayanthara and Siddharth was unveiled on Monday. The upcoming cricket drama will stream on Netflix this year.

The Royals teaser: Zeenat Aman makes a comeback in Ishaan, Bhumi's royal love storyThe teaser of Ishaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar's The Royals is finally out. Set to stream on Netflix, the upcoming drama also stars Zeenat Aman, Sakshi Tanwar and Milind Soman in key roles.

Akka teaser: Keerthy Suresh, Radhika Apte fight for supreme power in YRF's showNetflix unveiled the first look teaser of its highly-anticipated period thriller drama, Akka. It stars Radhika Apte and Keerthy Suresh in indomitable avatars.

general news.headline: Hat-trick for AAP or BJP, Congress resurgence? Delhi votes today Live UpdatesWill AAP hold its stronghold, the BJP end its losing streak, or the Congress stage a surprise comeback? Delhi decides today as 1.56 crore voters cast their ballots across all 70 constituencies.

US will take over Gaza: Trump's shock announcement with Netanyahu by his sideUS President Donald Trump said that the US will take over and develop Gaza, asserting long-term ownership, while Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called it a historic idea that could reshape Gaza's future.

Rs 5 lakh cash recovered from employee working at Delhi Chief Minister's officeRs 5 lakh cash was recovered from a bag inside a car in Delhi a day before Assembly elections. Gaurav, the owner of the cash said he worked at the Chief Minister's office. However, AAP has claimed that the incident is a "conspiracy" against the party.

'Age-reversing' CEO jabs India again for poor AQI, this time he cites a studyBryan Johnson, 47, made headlines this week after he walked out of Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's podcast midway due to poor air quality, saying that he felt a burning sensation in his throat and eyes, with rashes on his skin.

'Nothing will be left': Trump's warning if Iran tries to assassinate himIf Donald Trump were assassinated, Vice President JD Vance would become president and would not necessarily be bound by any instructions left by his predecessor. Federal authorities have been tracking Iranian threats against Trump and other administration officials for years.

FIR against Arvind Kejriwal for 'poison in Yamuna' remark hours before Delhi pollsA case has been filed against former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for his remarks that Haryana was "poisoning" Yamuna water. The complaint was filed by Jagmohan Manchanda.
Dry days in India: Outdated rule or necessary control?From Gandhi's vision of prohibition to the economic realities of today, we explore the history, politics, and impact of India's dry day policy.

PM recommends book on Nehru, jabs Congress, social media digs out excerptsPM Modi's remark is being seen as a counter to Rahul Gandhi's assertion that the government sent the External Affairs Minister 'three or four times' to the US to secure an invitation to Donald Trump's inauguration.

10 killed in Sweden school attack, shooter likely among themAt least 10 people died in the attack at a school in Sweden. Police have called it the "deadliest" attack in the country's history, adding that the shooter is among those dead.

Parunika absorbs Laxman pep-talk, Mithali Raj advice to live World Cup dreamIn an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, left-arm spinner Parunika Sisodia opened up on India's campaign in the U19 Women's T20 World Cup. Parunika was India's most economical bowler, having taken 10 wickets. The 19-year-old also won the Player of the Match award in the semi-final against England.

Netanyahu calls Trump 'greatest friend of Israel', discusses eliminating HamasBenjamin Netanyahu is the first foreign leader to visit the White House after Donald Trump returned to office on January 20. Besides the Gaza war, the two leaders also discussed strategies to counter Iran and hopes for a renewed push for an Israel-Saudi Arabia normalisation deal.

Lost control, says Swedish PM as immigrant gangs take over SwedenSweden, a country of mild-mannered people, is seeing a record rise in heinous crime. Ten people were shot dead on Tuesday. Such has been the rate of blasts and shootings, that Swedish PM Ulf Kristersson was forced to admit that the government had "lost control". This is how immigrants from the Middle East and Balkan nations ended up taking over the European nation.

Watch: Tendulkar sparks nostalgia with nets session before Masters LeagueMumbai Indians (MI) posted a video where Sachin Tendulkar can be seen training hard in the nets before taking part in the International Masters League, starting February 22.

Watch: Team India gets rousing reception on homecoming after U19 T20 World Cup win Niki Prasad's India returned to India on Tuesday and were welcomed with a rousing reception at the Bengaluru airport. On Sunday, India won the U19 Women's T20 World Cup after beating South Africa in the final.

Sam Konstas would open in WTC final, I'll be back in middle order: Travis HeadTravis Head has claimed that he expects Sam Konstas to open the batting for Australia during the World Test Championship Final against South Africa. Head also said that he could move back to the middle order for the final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
